author: Troy Pautz

review: The Apple TV unit itself works well.  The picture quality is great.  Apple keeps adding more channels and making the Apple TV more useful.That said, the Apple remote that comes with it is the worst remote in the history of remotes.  First the remote has only 3 buttons and the utterly useless scroll wheel. Seriously, who makes a remote without a power button? Apple that's who. It takes an eternity to log into your accounts and navigate trough the menus. Second, the remote is super tiny and therefor easily lost, hard to hold onto, and hard to use.  Third all the weight for the remote is in the back and the buttons are in the front making it even more awkward to hold onto and use.I like a lot about the Apple TV, but I rarely use it; mainly because the remote is so horrible.  Every time in try to watch something it takes forever to use the rubbish remote to get to what I want, pause, play, or navigate.  I end up saying "Worst remote ever," at least twice while trying to navigate the convoluted menus and get the show started and at least twice more while trying to put the unit in sleep mode.
author: Androstarr

review: This apple tv is smaller than I expected and seemed well made. I bought this apple tv primarily for its ability to mirror iPad onto my TV. Took me awhile to find out where the AirPlay is on my iPad. It is not on the desktop but around the play button while playing video. Initially I had sound but no video. It was due to my os4 on my original iPad. Once I updated my iPad to os7, problem solved. I also found out that it works with os5 on my iTouch. Wonderful device and it works very nicely with high def.
